manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SRS-XB13 Super compact. Big sound. EXTRA BASS Compact BLUETOOTH Speaker Available colors: Powder Blue (Amazon exclusive), Black, Taupe, Coral Pink, & Light Blue

Bring your music to life with EXTRA BASS A passive radiator works together with a full-range speaker to enhance low-end tones, giving bass a boost. Sound Diffusion Processor for expansive sound Sound Diffusion Processor spreads sound in any space, with its DSP technology.

Waterproof and dustproof Waterproof and dustproof with an IP67 rating and new UV coating for extra durability in the elements, you can take your speaker to the pool, the forest, the city, or wherever you’d like - the XB13 will keep on playing.

Up to 16 hours of battery life Listen for longer with up to 16 hours of battery life and convenient battery life indicator. Compact speaker with multiway strap The XB13 is durable and portable, and includes a specially engineered strap to make it easier to travel with. But don’t be fooled by its small size - this little speaker packs plenty of punch.

Stereo Sound Simply connect two speakers wirelessly for stereo sound. Hands-free calling The built-in mic lets you enjoy hands-free calling straight through your speaker. Connect to your phone Bluetooth Connection and Fast Pair technology to connect compatible Android devices, smartphones, or tablets in seconds – no pin or complex pairing. USB Type-C The USB Type-C port provides convenient connectivity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Little Speaker That Could
reviews.reviewText: My previous portable speaker (vintage 2008) had arrived at death's door, so I got the Sony as a replacement. The sound quality is rich and impressive. I was surprised by how much bass comes through. It's a snap to use, and it seems like just the right size. It fills the living room, or my car, with whatever I'm listening to. So far, the battery life has been nothing short of amazing (coming off a 15-year-old predecessor, I shouldn't be surprised).While the volume the Sony generates is perfect for my apartment, a space the size of a classroom is just beyond its abilities. Yes, my students can hear whatever song I play at circle time, but the sound is softer than I'd like in that setting; if the equipment lets me down at all, it's here. That said, there's a limit to what one can ask of a speaker smaller than a soda can.On the whole, I consider this mighty mite to have been money well-spent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So Far So Good
reviews.reviewText: We have only had this little speaker since Christmas, so I can't really attest to the longevity of the battery. We hooked it up with my husband's internet radio so he can listen in the kitchen. I agree with the reviewers who said the volume level is low, but turning the volume up on the radio it's paired with solves it for us. It has a great sound for such a little speaker, and my husband is very happy with it. Moreover, the room with the radio is a bit far from the kitchen, but it still transmits just fine. If anything changes in the next few months, I will add to this review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little speaker
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to have background Christmas music on Christmas Eve. It was perfect. Small and unobtrusive with great sound. One of my guests kept praising the sound and comparing it to a Bose. Very satisfied.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s a nice little speaker. It doesn’t go very loud but it’s good for a small room. Battery seems to last a while too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I wrote a review on this product a few weeks ago that does not reflect this product at all and I apologize for that. So I bought this speaker to use in the cab of my van until I can get the uconnect fixed. It did not work out very well so I replaced it with a small square JBL and that worked out great. I then started using this Sony in my house recently and it actually performs very well in a wide open space, I was very impressed and embarrassed at the same time but now that I think about it it's just a lesson learned and so here I am to correct my mistake. This speaker does perform very well and is very clear, I turned it all the way up and there was no distortion to speak of and gets pretty loud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I must use an enteral tube for feeding and anybody who knows what I'm talking about knows it's a boring process. I used to wear headphones during the feeding, but I also wear hearing aids, so even with over the ear phones, they were still uncomfortable. I bought this hoping it would make the headphones unnecessary. I underestimated this little speaker. When I took it out of the box, I thought, "How cute. Can it produce a loud enough sound?" Again, genius dude, underestimated. The first time I fired it up, I was very happily surprised. This little bugger has very good fidelity. The sound is crisp and fills a small room. I also use it to listen to student's speeches. It's that good.I heartily recommend this to anybody, with the proviso that it's not really for a large room, but if it's a small room, you will be surprised and happy with your purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Where's the bass?
reviews.reviewText: I want something small, portable, can be easily hung up, and loud to replace 1.5 year old JBL Go 3 that has a battery that's quickly failing. Short on time, as I'm only in the US for a few weeks, I've been playing this Sony SRX-XB13 mainly in the car while I run errands. The mids and highs are good, but it's been my experience that the bass is almost non-existent. This is playing pop, hip-hop, alternative, and spiritual music. Mids and highs are pretty good, however when I turn the volume all the way up, the sound distorts. This isn't excessively loud, but just almost loud enough.Maybe I received a dud, but I'd rather use the failing JBL or replace it with their newer model than use this Sony on my next trip.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was skeptical due to poor reviews, but awesome value at great price!
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical of sound quality since all YouTube reviewers mention some other brand speaker (JBL, Soundcore, “insert brand here”) is better sounding, has more bass, blah, blah, blah… I’ve been using a JBL charge 3 and JBL Xtreme 1 for a few years now. But when I first connected to this Sony XB13, I was amazed at how clear and well balanced it was. It is not a loud speaker, but it is loud enough to be able to hear your music indoors and out. Oddly enough, I find the sound quality to be better than the JBL charge 3, albeit, it is not as loud as the charge 3 and doesn’t have as much bass. However, if you prefer a clear sounding speaker that doesn’t sound muffled because it’s trying to make more bass, this is a speaker you must try. In terms of physical size, the diameter is about the same as a charge 3 (slightly smaller) and length wise, you will need 2.5 XB13s to be the same length as 1 charge 3. The quality of material is also very nice. It may not be as durable as the charge 3 if you are throwing it around and dropping it often because it will get scuffed and scratched, but I figure by the time it gets sufficiently damaged on the exterior, there will be a better speaker on the market at a similarly affordable price. All in all, I highly recommend this speaker!

Beautiful little speaker. Build quality is A++, it's this beautiful soft touch plastic that's almost rubbery but looks and feels really good. I'm no audiophile but to my ears this little thing sounds phenomenal, more than good enough for music, podcasts, movies, and calls. This is not a party speaker, and the JBL ones get louder- but I tested them both in the shop and this one didn't sound worse per say than bigger speakers, just smaller with a more compact sound. I got it for personal use- after owning a 2019 16' MacBook Pro and moving to a 13' MacBook Air, I was spoiled for sound. I mainly picked this over the more expensive JBL and Bose models because its battery life is rated at 16 hours (the other two had 12), and it's smaller and more compact (and cheaper to boot!) This thing is attractive, rugged, sounds good and is a total breeze to pair and switch between devices. Call quality is good, too. Packaging was eco friendly, too. Overall, really pleased with this speaker. The cloth loop it comes with can attach at either the top or the bottom edge of the speaker, meaning you can hang it from a hook in the bathroom and shower with your favourite music firing down at you!If you're looking for a compact, high quality speaker for personal use, this is brilliant, and great value.

The lack of an aux port as compared to the previous (now harder to buy) iteration is a major flaw for this product.For what it's worth, it's definitely able to take a few hard knocks. The lanyard strap came undone whilst hanging off a sling bag, when descending the stairs, causing the speaker to take a tumble onto the hard concrete stairs. Apart from that permanent nick, and some dust, the speaker was unaffected.This speaker does not have "low latency", due to the Bluetooth profiles it supports, nor a low latency mode.
